title: PFF predicts Steelers to lose offensive veteran to AFC West
description: Pro Football Focus predicted veteran guard Isaac Seumalo would leave the Pittsburgh Steelers for the AFC West.
fullText:
Pro Football Focus projected the landing spots for five of the top interior offensive linemen in free agency, which includes Pittsburgh Steelers veteran guard Isaac Seumalo.

According to PFF's Mason Cameron, Seumalo will predictably head to the Las Vegas Raiders, where the new Klint Kubiak regime will utilize his run-game prowess.

"Former Seahawks offensive coordinator and new Raiders head coach Klint Kubiak understands the importance of establishing a diverse run game to better allow for shot plays in the passing game through play action," Cameron wrote. "Seumalo‚Äôs skill set pairs well with that mentality. The 32-year-old guard has been excellent throughout his career with the Eagles and Steelers.

"During his three seasons in Pittsburgh, Seumalo showcased his talent as a run blocker in gap (82nd percentile) and zone (92nd percentile) concepts. But where he really sets himself apart is through his ability to sell the run out of play action without overextending, having generated the fourth-highest play-action PFF pass-blocking grade (87.8) among guards over the past three seasons."

Seumalo has appeared in 125 games, including 104 starts, during his time with the Eagles (2016‚Äì2022) and Steelers (2023‚Äì2025). He also earned the first Pro Bowl recognition of his career with Pittsburgh in 2024.

If Pittsburgh loses out on Seumalo, Buffalo Bills guard David Edwards would make an excellent substitution, with our Steelers Wire free agency scouting report giving fans a better idea of his potential fit.

title: NBA Rising Stars game 2026 announcers: Who's calling it on NBC?
description: Here's who's on the mic for the 2026 NBA All-Star Rising Stars on NBC.
fullText:
The 2026 NBA Rising Stars game is here, with some of the league's best young talented getting coached by some legends at the Intuit Dome -- check out our complete list of the teams and players who will be participating on Friday night.

But if you're here, you might be wondering: Who are the voices you're hearing who are announcing on NBC? Fear not! We have answers for you.

title: Aberdeen Central wrestlers second, Watertown third behind Sturgis in state A duals
description: Highlights from the South Dakota state Class A and B dual team wrestling tournaments on Feb. 13 and 14, 2026.
fullText:
Note: This story will be updated with photos and results from the state Class B dual tourney on Saturday.

PIERRE ‚Äî Top-seeded Sturgis capped an unbeaten season with a third-straight championship in the South Dakota State Class A dual team wrestling tournament on Friday, Feb. 13, 2026.

The Scoopers (23-0 in duals) defeated No. 8 seed Rapid City Central 56-13 in the first round, No. 4 Watertown 43-23 in the semifinals and No. 2 Aberdeen Central xx in the championship dual.

Sturgis also defeated Aberdeen Central 39-14 in the 2025 championship dual.

The state Class B dual tournament opens at 11 a.m. on Saturday, Feb. 14.

Here's highlights from Friday's Class A duals. Complete results can be found on www.trackwrestling.com.

No. 1 Sturgis 56, No. 8 Rapid City Central 13 ‚Äî The Scoopers won 11 of the 14 individual matches and received pins from Tyler Baldwin at 120 pounds, Parker Graveman at 132, Mason Hagen at 138, Benjamin Nadig at 150, Gavin Werlinger at 175, Kelson Dirk at 190 and Tyce Martinson at 285.

No. 4 Watertown 44, No. 5 Pierre 24 ‚Äî The Arrows won the battle of Eastern South Dakota Conference foes by getting falls from Braylon Schell at 106, Brody Randall at 126, Shea Richter at 132, Kutler Swenson at 138 and Cade Kuemper at 190. Alex Oedekoven (144) and Devin Binger (285) each recorded fall for Pierre.

No. 2 Aberdeen Central 49, No. 7 West Central 26 ‚Äî The Golden Eagles cruised into the semis with falls from Porter Lozenski at 157, Ridley Waldo at 165, Kaylor Swenson at 175, Grayden Timm at 190 and Owen Ward at 215. Bentley Klinkhammer (120), Alex Siemonsa (138) and Kash Garry (285) notched pins for WC.

No. 3 Brandon Valley 40, No. 6 Harrisburg 25 ‚Äî The Lynx advanced with pins from Anneyso Ahmed at 190 and Elijah Schunke at 285. Wyatt Davidson and Logan Johnson posted falls at 132 and 157, respectively, for Harrisburg.

Sturgis 43, Watertown 23 ‚Äî The Scoopers erased a 19-12 deficit by winning six of the final seven matches. Josiah Dimmer (144), Nadig, Werlinger, Dirk and Uherka each posted falls. Watertown received technical falls from Randall and Gage Lohr at 157.

Aberdeen Central 36, Brandon Valley 31 ‚Äî Aberdeen Central made it back to the finals with the help of falls from Mason Backous at 132, Lozenski, Waldo and Swenson. Beckett Rehorst at 126 and Schunke turned in falls for BV.

Pierre 37, Rapid City Central 29 ‚Äî Oedekoven and Binger again posted falls along with teammates Gabe Uhrig (120) and Alec Eilers (190) for Pierre. Sutton Paris (106) and Morgan Woods (215) won by pin for RCC.

Harrisburg 58, West Central 13 ‚Äî The Tigers bounced back with falls from Tayge Privett (175), Tayden Nguyen (215)and Cooper Hodge (286).

2025 STATE DUAL WRESTLING: Sturgis repeats in Class A dual team wrestling; Canton wins Class B for 3rd straight year

Sturgis 58, Aberdeen Central 7 ‚Äî Sturgis won 12 of the 14 matches in the victory, getting falls from Sullivan Sigman at 106, Graveman, Hagen, Jace Thurman at 150, Dirk and Uhreka. Waldo won by major decision at 165 and Backous added an OT decision at 132 for AC, which finished its season with a 22-3 dual record.

Watertown 37, Brandon Valley 31 ‚Äî Watertown (14-4) avenged a regular-season loss to Brandon Valley (17-5) when No. 1-rated Brody Randall of Watertown topped No. 2-rated Beckett Rehorst of BV 15-9 in the final match of the dual at 126 pounds. Braylon Schell (106), Richter and Max Stroup (138) all tallied falls for the Arrows. Braden Shoemaker (157), Cody Lindekugel (215) and Schunke each posted pins for BV.

Pierre 41, Harrisburg 27 ‚Äî Pierre (12-5) used pins from Noah Horsley (106), Walker West (132), Jordan Schafer (150), Porter Hunsley (165) and Kalo Steely (215) to grab the win. Myles Kettwig won by fall at 126 for Harrisburg.

Follow Watertown Public Opinion sports reporter Roger Merriam on X (formerly known as Twitter) @PO_Sports¬†or email: rmerriam@thepublicopinion.com

title: AZ high school girls soccer playoffs. Xavier wins, Perry upset
description: Xavier begin its pursuit of a 6th straight state title with two wins, Perry was upset in Round 2 and there's an epic battle being set up in 3A.
fullText:
The Arizona high school girls soccer playoffs are underway, with the first two rounds of the Open Division and the first round for the 3A and 2A tournaments completed.

It‚Äôs called the Open for a reason, and there are five, maybe six teams that have a real shot at lifting the gold ball for the state‚Äôs highest playoff classification, which combines the top three conferences into one bracket. But Phoenix Xavier Prep is in the midst of one of the greatest runs ever seen in the state.

The 6A, 5A and 4A fields are now set following the conclusion of the first two rounds of the Open. It was mostly chalk, but there were a few upsets.

Here's a rewind of the top moments during the week as we look ahead to the rest of the playoffs.

Xavier Prep is the five-time defending state champion and the team everyone is chasing. The Gators are seeking to make history ‚Äì only one other school, Chandler Seton Catholic in 3A, has won six consecutive Arizona girls' soccer titles. No. 5 Xavier is off to a hot start in the Open, routing Peoria Sunrise Mountain in Round 1 and Waddell Canyon View 7-0 in Round 2.

Chandler Hamilton and Queen Creek Casteel are two of the teams in the hunt to take down the Gators. Both have a history with Xavier. Hamilton, the No. 1 seed, took down Sahuarita Walden Grove 4-0 and Chandler Arizona College Prep 4-0. Casteel, No. 2, beat Tucson Catalina Foothills 4-0 and Anthem Boulder Creek 4-0. Last season, Casteel came painstakingly close to ending the Gators‚Äô run last year, losing in overtime in the title game. Same for Hamilton, losing 5-4 on penalty kicks in 2024.

Scottsdale Chaparral, No. 3, Chandler Basha, No. 4, and Phoenix Desert Vista, No. 11, are also in the mix as contenders.

Chaparral has won eight titles under coach Robyn Carlson. The program at Basha has been built into a respectable one by coach Ryan Watrous over the past four years, and the Bears will have a chance in the quarterfinals against Xavier. Desert Vista is the defending 6A state champion.

No. 8 Gilbert Perry has become a mainstay in the playoffs this decade, reaching the Open semifinals in 2025, the 6A quarterfinals in 2024, the 6A championship in 2023 and 2022 and the 6A semifinals in 2021. The 2-0 loss in Round 2 to No. 9 Gilbert Highland is a rarity for the Pumas and an upset, even though the teams are ranked so closely. Highland is a school filled with top-tier athletes, but it‚Äôs been 11 years since the school appeared in a championship final.

With the Open in the quarterfinals, that means the brackets for 6A, 5A and 4A are now finalized.

Perry falls back into 6A and immediately slots in as one of the favorites to win the 6A tournament as the No. 2 seed. Phoenix Pinnacle, No. 1, is in the mix as well after losing to Desert Vista in Round 2.

In 5A, Gilbert Campo Verde is the top seed and certainly headlines the group as one of the teams that can win it. But Scottsdale Notre Dame Prep, No. 5, should not be overlooked. The Saints won the 2024 state championship under coach Mike Varela and are a tough out.

Queen Creek Crismon‚Äôs Round 1 loss in the Open was technically the biggest upset, with No. 23-seeded Glendale Mountain Ridge beating the No. 10-seeded Rattlers. But that makes Crismon a heavy favorite to go all the way in 4A. Crismon features one of the most prolific players in state history, with senior forward Sydney Droen (144 goals, 112 assists).

Also watch for No. 2 Tucson Salpointe Catholic, No. 3 Flagstaff Coconino and No. 5 Surprise Paradise Honors.

Meanwhile, two schools in the 3A tournament are setting up what could be a slugfest in the championship game.

No. 1 Phoenix Northwest Christian cruised in its Round 1 game, winning 14-0 against San Tan Foothills. Northwest Christian is trying to get back on top after a run of three titles in four years from 2019-22.

No. 2 Gilbert Christian cruised as well, beating ALA Mesa North 16-0. Gilbert Christian has made three championship games since 2020, winning two (2020, 2024).

The two teams seem to be on a collision course for a competitive final ‚Äî unless No. 3 Queen Creek Benjamin Franklin has something to say about it.¬† The Chargers have won two titles in the past four seasons. Ben Franklin beat Page 6-0 in Round 1.

In 2A, all the higher seeds advanced. No. 1 Phoenix Country Day School beat North Phoenix Prep 2-0 and No. 2 Glendale Prep Academy beat Avondale St. John Paul Catholic II 6-0. Freshman forward Naomi Burge, the third-leading scorer in Arizona, continued her impressive first season with two more goals to make it 51 on the year.

Logan Stanley is a sports reporter with The Arizona Republic who primarily focuses on high school, college and Olympic sports. To suggest ideas for human-interest stories and other news, reach out to Stanley at logan.stanley@usatodayco.com or 707-293-7650. Follow him on X, formerly Twitter: @LSscribe.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: What we learned in Arizona high school girls soccer this week

title: NFL Insider Poses 'Incredible' George Pickens Question To Cowboys' Jerry Jones
description: George Pickens' future is up in the air at the time of writing, and that lends itself to all sorts of scenarios that could potentially play out.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys and George Pickens are getting set for a big offseason of contract talks, and you can bet it won't be smooth sailing.

With the Cowboys set to franchise Pickens, just as our own Mike Fisher reported back on November 27, that has led some to think the franchise could look to trade the Pro Bowl receiver and get something in return.

In truth, trading Pickens doesn't seem like a move that winning football teams make, and one could only imagine the backlash if the Cowboys trade Micah Parsons and then Pickens in back-to-back offseasons.

At the time of writing, we don't get the sense that Dallas wants to trade George, with Fish stating that some sections of people inside The Star would have an aneurysm if that were to happen.

So that tells you what the franchise thinks of Pickens.

It is here where NFL Network's Ian Rapoport offers his thoughts on what might entice Dallas to trade Pickens.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre going to franchise tag him, I just wonder what happens next,‚Äù Rapoport said. ‚ÄúHe had a breakout year. These are the guys you don't let walk in free agency, and he's been great. What I really don't know is, are the Cowboys going to get an offer for Pickens that would allow them to trade him?
"They acquired him for a three, what if they franchise-tagged [Pickens], he gets the long-term deal that he wants, and they [Cowboys] get a two back? That's incredible value. I wonder if that's something that would be palatable for the Cowboys."

If I were Dallas' general manager, a second-round pick would not be enough for me to move on from Pickens. In truth, given what we saw George do, not only for the offense as a whole, but for individual players, I'm not sure I'm letting him go at all. Barring a godfather-like offer, of course.

Instead, use the cap space and draft picks to rebuild the defense, while keeping the offense together.

This isn't the first time we have heard Dallas trading Pickens and getting a second-round pick back, and one thing we know about Rapoport is that he doesn't say things for the sake of it.

So there might be some merit to his line of thinking. He got that from somewhere.

How Jerry Jones approaches Pickens' contract will tell us a lot about where the owner's mind is regarding building a roster capable of winning a Super Bowl.

The offense with Pickens is more than capable of winning it all. It just needs a defense that can complement it.

If you trade away Pickens, you lose a huge part of what makes your offense great.

And in the process, might throw away a chance at finally making that NFC Championship game.

title: Brewers reportedly agree to deal with veteran infielder Luis Rengifo
description: The Brewers appear to have solved their third-base problem for now by agreeing to a one-year deal with veteran utility man Luis Rengifo.
fullText:
PHOENIX ‚Äì Just like that, it appears the Milwaukee Brewers have their third baseman for 2026.

According to a report from MLB.com's Mark Feinsand, Luis Rengifo has agreed to terms on a one-year pact worth $3.5 million with another $1.5 million available in incentives.

The deal, according to Feinsand, also includes a $10 million mutual option for 2027.

As of early Friday evening, Feb. 13 the Brewers had yet to announce the transaction.

To see Milwaukee make a move for Rengifo is hardly surprising considering the position had been thrown into tumult since the surprise trade of last season's starter, Caleb Durbin, to the Boston Red Sox on Feb. 9.

David Hamilton, acquired in the Durbin deal, and Jett Williams were the most likely candidates for the job heading into camp until the Rengifo addition, with prospects Brock Wilken, Luke Adams and Jes√∫s Made also expected to see time at third.

In Rengifo, the Brewers are buying low on a seven-year veteran of the major leagues who is coming off a down 2025 after compiling three straight productive seasons for the Los Angeles Angels.

A switch-hitter who turns 29 on Feb. 26, Rengifo hit .238 with nine home runs and 43 runs batted in with an OPS of .622 and 10 stolen bases in a career-high 147 games with the Angels last year.

Rengifo's strikeout rate isn't awful (19.2%, 62nd percentile in the majors) but he doesn't walk much, either (6.1%, 24th percentile). In addition, he struggled hitting the ball hard (24th percentile or lower in three key categories) with just 15th percentile bat speed.

Defensively, Rengifo also struggled, accounting for minus-seven outs above average and minus-five defensive runs saved in 76 games at third with a below-average throwing arm.

One facet of Rengifo's game is right up the Brewers' alley ‚Äì versatility. He also played 74 games at second base and 10 more spread between all three outfield positions.

Rengifo even logged a couple innings at shortstop.

He represents the second veteran to reportedly agree to terms with the Brewers this week; catcher Gary S√°nchez is also expected to come aboard on a one-year deal to serve as backup to William Contreras.

This article originally appeared on Milwaukee Journal Sentinel: Brewers reportedly agree to deal with veteran infielder Luis Rengifo

title: Ilia Malinin finishes stunning 8th in Olympics singles figure skating: 'I blew it'
description: Friday's men's singles final set up to be a coronation for American figure skater Ilia Malinin. But he wasn't able to overcome an slew of errors, finishing off the podium.
fullText:
Ilia Malinin finishes stunning 8th in Olympics singles figure skating: 'I blew it' originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

If the team event at the 2026 Winter Olympics was Ilia Malinin's introduction to the broader United States sporting fanbase, the men's singles served as something of a coronation.

Malinin, a Vienna, Virginia native, is widely considered to be figure skating's greatest talent. He's the only person to successfully complete a quadruple axel, having pulled off the feat a number of times throughout his still budding career.

Malinin flaunted his talent in the team event, overcoming a shaky short program to lead the Americans to gold. Men's singles, it seemed, would be a cakewalk -- a platform for the 21-year-old to enchant audiences before another gold medal danced along his neckline.

That didn't happen, though. Malinin suffered one of the biggest upsets in recent Olympic history, missing out on the podium entirely after falling victim to a number of uncharacteristic errors.

So, just what went wrong for Malinin on Friday afternoon? In short, everything. Here's what you need to know.

MORE:¬†Every mistake that cost Ilia Malinin an Olympic medal in men's singles

Malinin entered the contest with hopes of draping a second golden ornament around his neck. His dreams came crashing during his free skate program, a four-and-a-half minute routine that turned hellish following an early miscue. Malinin attempted to pull off a quadruple axel -- his signature skill. But he was turned away, unable to finish all of his rotations. He settled for a single axel, instead, setting the stage for an unusually nervy display.

The 21-year-old cratered into the ice shortly thereafter, losing his footing while attempting to land a quadruple toe loop. He tumbled into the slippery white plain once more during his routine. All told, Malinin lost out on 72 points during his jumps. That cost him dearly, seeing him fall into eighth-place, some 37 points shy of gold medalist Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan.

Ilia Malinin falls out of the podium in the men's singles final for figure skating.

Malinin finishes in 8th place. pic.twitter.com/c4ZvSrkmIB

‚Äî The Sporting News (@sportingnews) February 13, 2026

MORE:¬†Updated Winter Olympics medal count for every country

Malinin was gracious in defeat, congratulating Shaidorov when his score was read.

Despite the heartbreaking finish, Ilia Malinin went over to congratulate the men's singles final gold medal winner Mikhail Shaidorov üëè pic.twitter.com/Kcti5qFX0I

‚Äî The Sporting News (@sportingnews) February 13, 2026

He then spoke with NBC's Andrea Joyce, where he offered an honest assessment of his display.

"I blew it," Malinin said. "That's honestly the first thing that came to my mind was 'There's no way that just happened.' I mean, I was preparing the whole season, I felt so confident in my program. ... To just go out and that happens, I have no words, honestly."

When asked whether he could chalk up his errors to some physical limitation, Malinin was clear.

MORE:¬†Updated medal count for Team USA at 2026 Winter Olympics

"I just felt ready getting on that ice. But I think that maybe I was too confident that it was going to go well," Malinin said. "Honestly, it happened, I can't process what just happened. It happens."

"I think it was definitely mental. Now, finally experiencing that Olympic atmosphere, it's crazy, it's not like any other competition."

Malinin is 21 years old. He'll turned 21 on Dec. 2 of last year.

Malinin could have made his Olympic debut four years earlier. He placed second in the men's singles at the 2022 U.S. Championships, putting him in position to be selected for the U.S. roster as a 17-year old.

Despite his impressive exploits, Malinin missed out on the final roster, with U.S. Figure Skating selectors opting to select veterans Vincent Zhou and Jason Brown over him. Malinin's omission was a controversial one; U.S. Figure Skating argued that Zhou and Brown's body of work superseded Malinin, who had yet to make an appearance at junior worlds, junior Grand Prix or the 2021 U.S. Championships.

Malinin had to settle for a spot on the U.S.'s World Championships roster, instead. He finished fourth in the short program, but fell to ninth after struggling in free skate.

title: RJ Hampshire withdraws from Seattle Supercross with a foot injury
description: RJ Hampshire missed last week's round in Glendale, Arizona, due to illness. The date of his return has not been announced.
fullText:
RJ Hampshire will miss Round 6 of the SuperMotocross World Championship this week at Lumen Field in Seattle, Washington, after injuring his foot in a practice crash. This is the second straight week that Hampshire has withdrawn from competition after missing Round 5 in Glendale, Arizona, with flu-like symptoms.

The team has not provided a timeline for his return, but in a news release, the team said he has been "[ruled] out of upcoming rounds in the SMX World Championship."

"It‚Äôs never good to get a mid-morning phone call from Baker‚Äôs Factory on a ride day," said Nathan Ramsey, Rockstar Energy Husqvarna Team Manager. "Unfortunately, RJ had a crash, and the handlebars caught his foot in just the wrong way, resulting in a fracture. Our focus now is on the best path forward to get RJ healthy and back racing as soon as possible."

Hampshire entered Seattle 14th in the Monster Energy Supercross standings.

"One thing after another," Hampshire posted on social media. "Got back on the bike yesterday after getting over being sick. I slid over this small jump and had a slow/awkward fall that caused me to plant my foot. When I planted it, the end of the handlebars came down right on top of my boot, splitting the buckles. Broke two of the metatarsals and [one's] pretty displaced. Bummed on how it‚Äôs gone the last four months, sometimes it comes in waves. I‚Äôll rebuild and get where I know I can be."

title: Rob Thomson proud Nick Castellanos admitted bringing beer to dugout, which contributed to release
description: Deciding their relationship ruptured when Nick Castellanos angrily brought a beer into the dugout after he was pulled from a game, the Phillies released the outfielder even though they owe him $20 million for the final season of a five-year, $100 million contract.
fullText:
CLEARWATER, Fla. ‚Äî Turns out, the Philadelphia Phillies were ale-ing last year.

Deciding their relationship ruptured when Nick Castellanos angrily brought a beer into the dugout after he was pulled from a game, the Phillies released the outfielder even though they owe him $20 million for the final season of a five-year, $100 million contract.

Draught was an issue in a season that extended the team‚Äôs title drought.

In a four-page handwritten letter posted Thursday, Castellanos admitted he broke a team rule by bringing a Presidente beer into the dugout last June ‚Äúafter being taken out of a close ball game in front of my friends and family.‚Äù Phillies manager Rob Thomson made the move for defense with a 3-1 eighth-inning lead during a 5-2 win at Miami on June 16.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm proud of him because he owned up to what he did and, hey, we all make mistakes,‚Äù Thomson said Friday. ‚ÄúNick had helped us out in a lot of ways here. He‚Äôs had some big hits and big plays and helped us win a lot ballgames. So I do, I wish him all the best.‚Äù

During a season that ended with a Division Series loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers, Castellanos hit .250 ‚Äî his lowest in a non-shortened season ‚Äî with 17 homers and 72 RBIs.

Any team can sign Castellanos for the $780,000 major league minimum. Phillies president of baseball operations Dave Dombrowski had decided Castellanos wouldn‚Äôt report to the team for spring training ‚Äî the 33-year-old did not have a locker assigned and two photos of him in the corridor of player images already had been removed.

‚ÄúA lot of times when a good player has their role change with the club, it can cause some friction, and his role changed last year from where it was,‚Äù Dombrowski said. ‚ÄúI mean you played every single day for a lot years in a row, and so sometimes that can contribute to it. Sometimes then people have debates between themselves where they‚Äôre not all on the same page. But when you put all that together, sometimes you just need to make sure that you have a change of scenery.‚Äù

Castellanos‚Äô minus-12 outs above average ‚Äî how many outs they gain defensively over the average fielder at their position, according to MLB Statcast ‚Äî tied the New York Mets‚Äô Juan Soto and the Los Angeles Angels‚Äô Jo Adell for 108th and last among 110 qualified outfielders.

Castellanos was removed for Johan Rojas, who took over in center as Brandon Marsh moved from center to left and Max Kepler from left to right.

‚ÄúI then sat right next to Rob and let him know that too much Slack in some areas and too tight of restrictions in others and not (conducive) to us winning,‚Äù Castellanos wrote. ‚ÄúShoutout to my teammates and Howie (Phillies special assistant Howie Kendrick) for taking the beer out of my hands before I could take a sip.

Castellanos said he ‚Äúaired out our differences‚Äù after the game during a meeting with Thomson and Dombrowski.

‚ÄúThe conversation ended with me apologizing for letting my emotions get the best of me,‚Äù Castellanos wrote.

Castellanos was benched the next day for what Thomson said then was ‚Äúan inappropriate comment.‚Äù Castellanos wrote the Phillies told him not to divulge details to reporters.

‚ÄúI was surprised that a lot of people didn‚Äôt see what was taking place at the time,‚Äù Dombrowski said.

Thomson doesn‚Äôt regret the messy details didn‚Äôt become public at the time.

‚ÄúI thought it was appropriate what we did,‚Äù he said.

Castellanos appeared in 75 of the team‚Äôs final 90 regular season games and hit .133 with three RBIs in the four-game Division Series loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers. His production decline led to the decision as much as the beer beef.

‚ÄúThat wasn‚Äôt the final or determining factor, because if that was, we would have done that at that particular time,‚Äù Dombrowski said.

Philadelphia secured a replacement in December, agreeing to a one-year, $10 million contract with Adolis Garc√≠a.

Reporting for the new season and hoping to win Philadelphia‚Äôs first title since 2008, Phillies slugger Kyle Schwarber wished Castellanos the best.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had a lot of really good memories here over the last four years and he‚Äôs had some really big moments with us,‚Äù Schwarber said. ‚ÄúHopefully wherever he goes next, he‚Äôs able to keep going out there and keep doing his thing and keep having those big moments.‚Äù

title: Sweden accuses Canada of cheating in men's curling match at Olympics
description: The Canadian and Swedish men's curling teams had a heated moment at the Olympics on Friday, as Sweden accused Canada of cheating.
fullText:
The Canadian men's curling team closed out a successful 2-0 day at the 2026 Winter Olympics with a narrow win over Sweden.

But before a winner could be crowned in Cortina d'Ampezzo, there were tensions between the two teams.

REQUIRED READING: Winter Olympics updates: Quad God misses gold, US women's hockey in action

Following the ninth end, Canada and Sweden broke out into a heated verbal confrontation on the ice at the Cortina Curling Olympic Stadium. The incident was sparked by Sweden‚Äôs¬†Oskar Eriksson claiming Canada's Marc Kennedy double-touched his rock after releasing it before the hog line.

"Apparently it‚Äôs OK touching the rock after the hog line,"¬†Eriksson said while clearing the house, according to the Toronto Star. Per the Star, Eriksson's comments were immediately answered by responses of "who?" "I haven‚Äôt done it once" and "Don‚Äôt chirp" by Kennedy.

Canada closed out its 8-6 win over Sweden with a point in the 10th end, moving them to 3-0 in the round-robin standings.

REQUIRED READING: Ilia Malinin hot mic says Beijing Olympics experience could have prevented 2026 disaster

The issue the Swedes had, according to Reuters, was that they thought Kennedy and Canada were making contact with the stone beyond the hog line, which is the line on the sheet of ice where curlers must let go of the curling stone during delivery.

World Curling has introduced¬†electronic handles¬†on the stones at the 2026 Winter Olympics, a technology piece that will tell officials if double-touching with the stone happened. Eriksson mentioned Sweden thought Kennedy was touching the stone and not the handle containing the sensor, which would not set off the red lights.

"He asked who we thought was over the hog line and I pointed out who we thought was touching the rock," Eriksson said. "It was obviously not a red light, but some players are touching the rock, according to us. And that's not allowed. ... We told the officials. They came out and they misread the rules, sadly.

"Because they thought double-touching any part of the rock is OK. And then they found out that was wrong. You can only touch the electronic part of the handle."

Asked about the incident following the match, Kennedy said he didn't like being accused of cheating.

"It's good. It's (a) sport. It's the Olympics. Both teams are trying to win," Kennedy said after the matchup, according to Reuters. "Oskar was accusing us of cheating. I didn't like it. I've been curling professionally for 25 years."

He later added: "There's hog line devices on there. I don't know. And he's still accusing us of cheating. I didn't like it. So I told him where to stick it."

In a statement to Reuters, World Curling said that umpires had been set at the hog line to monitor deliveries for three ends after the issue was first raised during the game, but that there were "no hog line violations or retouches of the stone during the observation."

Both teams return to action on Saturday, Feb. 14 for one game each. Canada takes on Switzerland at 8:05 a.m. ET, while Sweden takes on China at the same time.

title: Enquirer names Cincinnati high school athletes of the week for Feb. 13

title: Aaron Rodgers ranked No. 16 quarterback by NFL analyst
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback ranked high in the quarterback rankings.
fullText:
The Pittsburgh Steelers have made it clear that they would like to have Aaron Rodgers return for a second season in Pittsbugh, and a 22nd season in the NFL overall. The 42-year-old entered 2025 on a one-year deal with the intention of it being his final season. However, he kept the door open to return in 2026, and now the Steelers await his decision.

In terms of his performance in 2025, Rodgers threw 24 touchdowns to just seven interceptions and led the Steelers to an AFC North championship. It‚Äôs because of that year-long outing that Nick Shook of NFL Media ranked Rodgers as the No. 16 quarterback amongst all 63 to start a game in 2025.

‚ÄúAaron Rodgers¬†bested Father Time for much of 2025 and is the primary reason the Steelers even reached the playoffs,‚Äù Shook writes. ‚ÄúHe produced some of his best games of the last three or four years and can definitely still fill a starting job somewhere in this league¬†if he wants it.‚Äù

Rodgers was sandwiched between Brock Purdy (No. 15) and Baker Mayfield (No. 17).

Should Rodgers return, he would reunite with his former head coach in Green Bay, Mike McCarthy.

Let us know what you think in the comments.¬†Be sure to bookmark Behind the Steel Curtain for all the latest news, breakdowns, and more!

title: Vanderbilt will reportedly be without star guard vs. Texas A&M
description: For the fifth consecutive games, Vanderbilt will be without its second leading scorer Duke Miles, who is averaging 16.6 PPG.
fullText:
Texas A&M (17-6, 7-4 SEC) is attempting to end what has been a disappointing losing streak after falling to Missouri 86-85 in one of the more heartbreaking losses this season, surrendering 56 points in the paint, as the last two losses vs. Florida and the Tigers were mainly due to the size differential in the front court.

Playing in the SEC is never an easy task, and while the Aggies started out 7-1, including Quad 1A road wins over Auburn, Texas, and Georgia, the blowout out loss to Florida was due to poor shooting, while a the three-point road loss to Alabama, followed by Wednesday's one-point loss to the Tigers proved that Texas A&M can't be counted out of any game, but need to play much better defense moving forward.

Before hosing a winnable midweek matchup vs. Ole Miss, Texas A&M is back on the road to take on No. 19 Vanderbilt, facing a Commodores team that has both looked like a national championship contender and an average SEC team within the span of two weeks, and will be without it's star guard Duke Miles for the fifth consecutive game, combined with guard Frankie Collins, who has been out since early December.

Duke Miles is second on the team in scoring (16.6 PPG), while Vanderbilt is 4-1 without him in the lineup, and is considering a 3-seed or higher in the NCAA Tournament. For Texas A&M, facing a similarly sized team should help the offense find some consistency, and it will be tasked with playing better perimeter defense, as the Commodores are shooting 36% from beyond the arc and nearly 50% from the field.

Texas A&M will face No. 19 Vanderbilt on Saturday at 12:00 p.m. CT. The game will air on the SEC Network.

Vanderbilt‚Äôs Duke Miles (knee) and Frankie Collins (knee) are both OUT for Saturday‚Äôs game against Texas A&M, per Mark Byington.

Miles averages 16.6 PPG and has not played since 1/24.

Collins averages 7.8 PPG and has not played since 12/17.

‚Äî Jon Rothstein (@JonRothstein) February 13, 2026

title: Rickie Fowler's 64 at Spyglass is more evidence he's overcoming last year's injury woes
description: Rickie Fowler already has two top-20 finishes this season and heads into Pebble Beach weekend with shot at title
fullText:
PEBBLE BEACH ‚Äî Rickie Fowler‚Äôs primary goal for 2026 is rather simple, summed up in two words. ‚ÄúFeel better.‚Äù

MORE: Swifties flock to Pebble Beach

He would like to play better, too, but it‚Äôs hard to have one without the other, and Fowler just didn‚Äôt feel good throughout last season as he dealt with a stubborn left shoulder injury. And by stubborn, we mean chronic‚Äîsomething, he said, that has been an issue since high school. Somehow, the six-time PGA Tour winner managed to play well enough to finish among the top 50 in the FedEx Cup standings, ensuring a spot in all of this year‚Äôs signature events and allowing him to take an extended sabbatical in the fall to heal.

‚ÄúI definitely earned the time off with sneaking inside that top 50, so that was a nice bonus,‚Äù Fowler said Friday at the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am. ‚ÄúThat was what I was trying to work towards to earn that time off and then be able to get into a position where I could get the body in a better spot and go play this year.‚Äù

Incredibly, Fowler had only three top-10 finishes last year, but two of those were in the FedEx Cup Playoffs.

He obviously is feeling better these days, and after a second-round eight-under 64 at Spyglass Hill, the California native he has a chance to win a tournament that hasn‚Äôt been particularly kind to him. At 14-under 130, Fowler is tied for third, one stroke behind Akshay Bhatia and Ryo Hisatsune. He has never finished in the top 10 in this event.

At least Fowler can claim to have enjoyed a cool celebrity moment‚Äîeven though it wasn‚Äôt during this tournament.

‚ÄúMaybe one of my first memories, I caddied for [Mark] Wahlberg in the U.S. Open Challenge prior to the 2010 U.S. Open,‚Äù he recalled of the event sponsored by Golf Digest on the weekend prior to the championship. ‚ÄúI think we were‚ÄîI say ‚Äòwe‚Äô because I was caddying‚Äîbut I think Mark was the only one to break 100 [he shot 97], so got that under my belt.‚Äù

Fowler, 37, is making his third start this year and has a pair of T-18 finishes under his belt. His swing is dialed in‚Äîhe led the field in strokes gained/approach at 4.782 on Friday‚Äîand overall, he is comfortable with his game. He converted nine birdies against just one bogey at Spyglass on another relatively calm day on the Monterey Peninsula.

‚ÄúI wouldn't say there's a specific part of the game that has either held me back or pushed me forward. Everything's been fairly solid,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI will say I've done a good job, you know, sometimes on the greens especially over at Pebble can get a little bouncy on the Poa. Spy typically rolls quite a bit better. I've done a good job of just committing and hitting a lot of good putts.

‚ÄúYeah, especially when we get weather like this after we got through some of the rain, this is just a fun part of the world to be in.‚Äù

And especially when you‚Äôre feeling better.

title: Cubs news: Cubs sign reliever Shelby Miller
description: The Cubs locked up an injured reliever to get ready for the 2027 season.
fullText:
The Cubs have reportedly agreed to a two-year deal with veteran right-handed reliever Shelby Miller. Fansided‚Äôs Robert Murray was reportedly first with the news.

Sources: Free-agent reliever Shelby Miller and the Chicago Cubs are nearing a multi-year major-league contract.¬†https://t.co/CpGcbS9bFA

‚Äî Robert Murray (@ByRobertMurray) February 13, 2026

Miller, 35, pitched quite effectively last year with the Diamondbacks, posting a 1.98 ERA and ten saves in 37 games before he was traded to the Brewers at the trade deadline, even though he was on the injured list at the time with a right-forearm strain. He returned from the IL in early August and mostly pitched well until a game on September 1 when Miller felt a ‚Äúpop‚Äù in elbow. That turned out to be a torn ulnar collateral ligament, which lead to his second Tommy John surgery. Miller is expected to miss all of 2026 and return in 2027, so this two-year deal is really a deal for 2027 for the Cubs.

Miller is an 11-year veteran who has pitched for ten teams, including the Cubs in 2021. He signed with the Cubs in Spring Training in 2021 and made three mostly-poor relief appearances until he went on the injured list with a back injury. The Cubs released him in May of that year when it was time for him to come off the injured list. Since then, Miller has bounced around with good seasons with the Dodgers in 2023 and Arizona last year and a poor season with the Tigers in 2024.

Miller began his career as starter in the Cardinals system and was traded to Atlanta as part of a package for Jason Heyward in 2014. In 2015, Atlanta dealt Miller to Arizona as part of a package for Dansby Swanson. Miller has also pitched for the Rangers and Pirates. He has not started a game since 2019.

title: UNC reports $14M deficit after record athletic spending year
description: The University of North Carolina went on a major hiring spree this past year. Bill Belichick came in as football coach, Michael Lombardi stepped up as football general manager, Jim Tanner joined the basketball program in a similar capacity, and‚Ä¶
fullText:
The University of North Carolina went on a major hiring spree this past year. Bill Belichick came in as football coach, Michael Lombardi stepped up as football general manager, Jim Tanner joined the basketball program in a similar capacity, and Steve Newmark was named athletic director-in-waiting.

The spending that followed tells its own story.

MORE: NCAA may appeal judge‚Äôs Trinidad Chambliss decision due to concerning details

UNC‚Äôs latest NCAA financial report shows the athletic department hit a record $188 million in expenses for the 2024-25 academic year. That includes nearly $14 million paid out upfront to athletes through name, image and likeness deals.

Revenue came in at $173 million, leaving the Tar Heels with a $14 million deficit at the end of the fiscal year on June 30, 2025. Department reserves covered the gap.

The University of North Carolina posted a $14 million loss for 2025 after spending a record-breaking $188 million on multiple major hires, including football coach Bill Belichick

‚Äî Ball Exclusives (@ballexclusives) February 14, 2026

On the field, there were real wins. UNC took home national titles in women‚Äôs soccer and women‚Äôs lacrosse, and the field hockey team made the Final Four. Football and men‚Äôs basketball were a different story.

The football team finished 6-7, and the men‚Äôs basketball program barely squeaked into the 68-team field before getting knocked out in the first round.

Meanwhile, the bills kept climbing, per WRAL. Athletic department costs have gone up more than $67 million over four years and aren‚Äôt slowing down. The school plans to share $20.5 million in revenue with athletes across four sports and add close to 200 scholarships.

Belichick, who signed a five-year, $50 million deal, just wrapped his first season in Chapel Hill. During the fiscal year covered in the report, UNC paid around $35 million in coaching salaries and benefits, plus over $29 million for support staff and administrators.

That‚Äôs more than $6 million higher than the year before. Nearly $4 million in severance also went out, all tied to football.

title: Yankees‚Äô Gerrit Cole throws 1st bullpen of spring training as he works back from Tommy John surgery
description: Yankees manager Aaron Boone won‚Äôt push for an early return, preferring to have Cole at optimum strength late in the season and October.
fullText:
TAMPA, Fla. ‚Äî Yankees ace Gerrit Cole threw his first bullpen of spring training on Friday, may pitch in exhibition games and is on track to return to regular-season action from May to September.

A 35-year-old right-hander, Cole had Tommy John surgery March 11 with Los Angeles Dodgers team physician Dr. Neal ElAttrache.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had a lot of discussions between myself, the Yankees and Dr. ElAttrache,‚Äù Cole said. ‚ÄúWith a full Tommy John reconstruction surgery, the target‚Äôs always between 14 and 18 months so that really hasn‚Äôt changed and that‚Äôs what the research says.‚Äù

Yankees manager Aaron Boone won‚Äôt push for an early return, preferring to have Cole at optimum strength late in the season and October.

‚ÄúWe want to make sure we give him the proper time to make sure he is good and ready to come back, built up in a smart way,‚Äù Boone said. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt want to speed things up for the sake of a couple starts at the front end that could affect the overall product.‚Äù

Cole threw his first bullpen in October following surgery. He pitched at Steinbrenner Field with a beard ‚Äî the Yankees relaxed their facial hair policy last year.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been long and tedious, like most people‚Äôs experiences. As we get closer to the end, things start to gain a little momentum,‚Äù Cole said. ‚ÄúI just kind of am doing exactly what I‚Äôve been told. So when I‚Äôm told to push, I push. When I‚Äôm told not to, I don‚Äôt.‚Äù

Thus far, his elbow feels better than it did two years ago.

‚ÄúIt feels really good,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt feels different than it has been in quite some time.‚Äù

‚ÄúEverything looks like it‚Äôs coming out free and easy ‚Äî command. He just looks to be in a really good place,‚Äù Boone said. ‚ÄúYou know that diver that dives off the high board and just goes in the water and makes like no splash? That‚Äôs Gerrit on the mound.‚Äù

Cole altered his windup, putting his hands over his head. Before he was hurt, he stopped at his chest.

‚ÄúIt feels good,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúJust throwing on the backfields during the summer and tried it out. I‚Äôve had little idiosyncrasies that have changed over the years from still hands to a drop or hands off of the body, close to the body. I think I generally just like the rhythm of it.‚Äù

His last official outing was in Game 5 of the 2024 World Series that Oct. 30. He pitched in two spring training games in 2025, the last on March 6.

‚ÄùSome silver linings, you get more family time,‚Äù Cole said. ‚ÄúI miss that outlet of working hard and feeling exhausted every five days.‚Äù

After re-signing Paul Goldschmidt to a $4 million, one-year contract on Thursday, the Yankees have 24 of the 26 players from last year‚Äôs Division Series roster ‚Äî all but relievers Devin Williams and Luke Weaver, who left as free agents and signed with the Mets.

Left-hander Ryan Weathers, acquired from Miami, appears to be the most significant addition.

‚ÄúFrom a macro standpoint, I think we assessed last year‚Äôs team as a really good team. I think it played very well. It ultimately fell short,‚Äù Cashman said. ‚ÄúIn a micro standpoint, when you‚Äôre looking at individual decisions that add up to in theory ‚Äòrunning it back,‚Äô which is the term we‚Äôre hearing so much of and understandably so, I think it‚Äôs more you engage the current marketplace and it‚Äôs an acknowledgement: A, I think we had really good players that were great competitors and B, when I started trying to match up in the marketplace via trade or free agent signs, we wound up comfortable with every individual choice of whether it‚Äôs retaining, bringing back, reacquiring.‚Äù

Without a World Series title since 2009, the Yankees lost to Toronto in last year‚Äôs Division Series.

‚ÄúCertainly not apologetic of the team we had last year,‚Äù Cashman said. ‚ÄúIt was a really strong team. A lot of people, experts in the game expected ‚Äî not expected but predicted could win a world championship.‚Äù

Right-hander Rafael Montero agreed to a minor league contract. The 35-year-old was 1-2 with a 4.48 ERA in 59 relief appearances last year for Houston, Atlanta and Detroit.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs some things we really liked that he was doing last year,‚Äù Boone said. ‚ÄúMaybe some small adjustments we can make to help him and hopefully he can push himself into the mix.‚Äù

title: Geoff Ogilvy on his favorite designs (and what makes them great)
description: Geoff Ogilvy joined GOLF's Subpar podcast to discuss his favorite golf courses, the 2026 Presidents Cup, the PGA Tour schedule and more.
fullText:
There are few current or former pros who boast the same combination of on-course success and design chops as Geoff Ogilvy.

Ogilvy won eight times on the PGA Tour, including the 2006 U.S. Open, and is now a member of OCM golf course architects (along with Mike Cocking and Ashley Mead). He‚Äôs also about to captain the 2026 International Presidents Cup team at Medinah No. 3, a course OCM recently renovated.

Ogilvy, 48, was the guest on this week‚Äôs episode of GOLF‚Äôs Subpar podcast and discussed that recent reno, this year‚Äôs Presidents Cup and his love of golf course architecture. One question he was asked focused on his favorite courses from a design perspective.

‚ÄúRoyal Melbourne [in Australia] is great,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty doable for the average player. But it‚Äôs really hard for [pros], especially when the pins are tough. ‚Ä¶ If you miss it in the wrong spot, it‚Äôs a bit like the Masters, you just magnify your error. Every time you make an error you just have more trouble trying to get back on track. Royal Melbourne does that in a really subtle way and it catches up with you.‚Äù

Ogilvy said that while he loves Pine Valley in New Jersey ‚Äî¬†which has long been GOLF‚Äôs top-ranked course in the world ‚Äî he says it‚Äôs too difficult for most golfers but probably the best course in the world for great players.

He‚Äôs also a big fan of the Old Course in St. Andrews.

‚ÄúI think [the Old Course] gets better every time you go around and you sort of learn something more,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs shaped by nature and the way people played the game rather than shaped by a person. You can play it conservatively all day and you‚Äôll hit 16-17 greens in regulation ‚Äî¬†no one can hit 17 in two ‚Äî but you‚Äôll hit most greens in regulation. But you‚Äôll have 50-footers all day, so then you‚Äôll get braver and braver and you‚Äôll start taking on the bunkers and out of bounds and then you‚Äôll start making birdies and think this place is pretty simple, but then you‚Äôll get burned and hit into the bunker and make a triple and then you go back to being conservative again. You seem to go in these cycles. The higher the quality your shot, that‚Äôs how much easier your next shot is. That place does it better than anywhere.‚Äù

To listen to the entire podcast with Ogilvy, click here, or watch on YouTube below.

The post Geoff Ogilvy on his favorite designs (and what makes them great) appeared first on Golf.

title: AEW Collision Viewership & Ratings Report: 2/7/2026
description: Despite the excitement leading in to "Grand Slam: Australia," viewership was down for the February 7 edition of "AEW Collision."
fullText:
The February 7 edition of "AEW Collision" helped set up not only the following Wednesday's huge episode of "AEW Dynamite," which saw two title changes, but also Saturday's "Grand Slam: Australia." Despite the excitement for things to come in AEW, the show saw a decrease in viewership from the previous week.

According to Wrestlenomics, the February 7 episode of "Collision" drew an average of 388,000 viewers, down 21 percent from the previous week's average of 492,000 viewers. The show earned a 0.07 in the ever-important ages 18-49 demographic, which was no change from the January 31 show.

The episode versus the trailing four weeks average was positive in terms of viewership, up 15 percent from the average 339,000 viewers. Compared to this time last year, the average viewership for "Collision" is also up, to the tune of 16 percent from the February 2025 average of 335,000 viewers. This episode's rating versus the trailing four weeks average was also positive, up 75 percent from the average 0.04. Compared to this time last year, however, the rating is down 22 percent from an average of 0.09.

"Collision" saw then-AEW Women's Champion Kris Statlander chose the stipulation for her "Dynamite" match against Thekla, and the champion decided on a strap match, which would ultimately see her downfall in days ahead. Elsewhere on the show, Marina Shafir and Wheeler Yuta got a victory ahead of their hair-versus-hair match against "Timeless" Toni Storm and Orange Cassidy at Grand Slam. The main event saw Tommaso Ciampa successfully defend the TNT Championship against Roderick Strong and Claudio¬†Castagnoli.

Don't miss any of the major wrestling headlines. You can also add us as a preferred search source on Google.

title: Chicago Bears 2026 Roster Turnover: Is this the best tight end duo in the NFL?
description: Part 3 of @wiltfongjr‚Äôs Bears roster turnover series focuses on the tight ends. Does Chicago have the best duo in the league?
fullText:
Chicago Bears head coach Ben Johnson changed his offensive scheme from what he used in Detroit to better utilize his roster, but a few principles remained. He wants to run the ball, use play action, and get his tight ends involved. He also expects his tight ends to be versatile so that he can line them up anywhere on the field.

In 2025, the Bears used the sixth-highest¬†percentage¬†of 12 personnel (1 running back, 2 tight ends) in the NFL and the fifth-highest percentage of 13 personnel.

Johnson‚Äôs offense will continue to evolve schematically, but I can‚Äôt see Ben deviating too far from his use of tight ends, which makes this an important position that needs quality depth.

Here‚Äôs how the Bears‚Äô tight end room currently shapes up.

Colston Loveland ‚Äì Signed through 2028* ‚Äì¬†Loveland was one of the most dynamic rookies in the NFL, and this was after a slow start to the season. He flashed elite traits and appears primed to push for the Pro Bowl next season. His athleticism makes him a perfect ‚Äúmove‚Äù tight end, but he didn‚Äôt seem to mind lining up as the Y and blocking either. It‚Äôs easy to see why the Bears valued his skill set at 10 overall in the draft, and why his ceiling is even higher than that of a perennial Pro Bowler.

*Bears have the fifth-year option for 2029.

Cole Kmet ‚Äì Signed through 2027 ‚Äì The Bears could save about $8 million if they move on from Kmet, but I think it‚Äôs more likely they rework his deal and sign him to an extension. Kmet has become a reliable in-line blocker, but he‚Äôs athletic enough to line up wide or in the backfield. He‚Äôll likely never approach the 73 receptions he had in 2023, but he plays an important role in Johnson‚Äôs offense.

Loveland and Kmet make up one of the best tight end duos in the NFL.

Durham Smythe ‚Äì Free agent ‚Äì The 30-year-old veteran played in a quarter of the Bears‚Äô offensive snaps (293) and the sixth-most snaps on special teams (230). I can see the Bears bringing him back on another one-year deal.

The next three players spent time on Chicago‚Äôs practice squad in 2025 and signed reserve/futures contracts.

Stephen Carlson ‚Äì Signed through 2026 ‚Äì¬†Carlson has been with the Bears since 2023, but he‚Äôs only appeared in three games. He‚Äôs a solid veteran option to call up from the practice squad, but at 29 years old, he‚Äôs probably never going to crack a 53-man roster.

Nikola Kalinic ‚Äì Signed through 2026 ‚Äì¬†The 29-year-old began his career in the CFL in 2019, and the Bears are his fourth NFL team since 2022. He played in two games for the Bears in 2025, making 3 special teams tackles.

Qadir Ismail ‚Äì Signed through 2026 ‚Äì¬†The Bears are his fifth NFL team since being a Ravens UDFA in 2024. At 6‚Äô6‚Äù, 232 pounds, he‚Äôs a good athlete who started his collegiate career as a quarterback for¬†Villanova¬†and finished it as a wide receiver for Samford. His dad, Qadry, was a ten-year veteran in the NFL.

2026 OUTLOOK ‚Äì¬†Assuming Kmet stays, the Bears won‚Äôt be addressing this position with big money in free agency or a high draft pick. However, some bottom of the depth chart competition should come from a UDFA or two.

What do you think will happen at tight end this offseason?

title: Mike LaFleur realizes what the Arizona Cardinals experienced in 2025
description: Nick Rallis returns as DC under new head coach Mike LaFleur.
fullText:
While many Arizona Cardinals fans lose their minds over the decision to have Nick Rallis return as the team‚Äôs defensive coordinator, it‚Äôs obvious new head coach Mike LaFleur paid more attention to what affected the Cardinals in 2025 than those fans did.

In an interview with Cardinals reporter Dani Sureck after being introduced to the media 10 days ago, LaFleur was asked the impression the team‚Äôs defense had on him after playing against them six times in the last three seasons.

‚ÄúWe've had some rough days against this defense,‚Äù he said.

For those who are guffawing at that comment and have serious cases of collective amnesia, consider that the Rams scored a total of 23 points in the two 2024 games against the Cardinals.

As for the troubles last season, LaFleur addressed that when he said, ‚ÄúJust going back to this year (2025) because every year changes, when we played them the first time, I think it was Week 11, maybe Week 12 from an NFL season standpoint, but our 11th game. And I remember (quarterback) Matthew (Stafford) coming into me on that Tuesday saying this doesn't look like their record. This looks like a really good defense because there are players there.‚Äù

Of course, as many understand but not those that reside in the coaches-are-bad bubble, LaFleur obviously did when he noted,¬†"Unfortunately a lot of them weren't out there, particularly in that back half of the season. So that's my job and our job as a building to figure out how we can make sure that those best players are consistently out on the field."

Reality in the NFL is that game planning and in-game calls on both sides of the ball are based¬†on what players are capable of and who is available. The facts are that during the 2025 season, 21 defensive players missed 161 games. Eleven were on a reserve list with an injury during the season. In the final nine games, 19 players missed 82 games. That can't be ignored even though many people do.

As LaFleur said in a statement Friday,¬†‚ÄúNick is someone I have always had great respect for, especially going against him in the division over the last three years. During the interview process, I expressed that he was someone I held in high regard and would be very interested in talking to about the position.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve had the chance to meet with him and pick his brain over the last couple weeks and am even more impressed than I was before. I know the respect he has from coaches around the league and especially with the players on this team and that says a lot to me.‚Äù

Even if the loud outside narrative believes they know more than those that watch hours and hours of tape while actually working and grinding in the sport.

Get more Cardinals and NFL coverage from Cards Wire's Jess Root and others by listening to the latest on the Rise Up, See Red podcast. Subscribe on Spotify,¬†YouTube¬†or¬†Apple podcasts.

title: Gerrit Cole wows Yankees in first bullpen of spring training: ‚ÄòHe looked like a Cy Young pitcher‚Äô
description: TAMPA, Fla. ‚Äî As Gerrit Cole threw his first bullpen of spring training on Friday morning, a crowd of reporters made their best efforts to get a look through the mostly-covered fence that encaged the rehabbing righty. While those with cameras took turns sharing limited peepholes in order to snap a shot of Cole, who underwent Tommy John surgery last spring, the contingent that stood behind him ...
fullText:
TAMPA, Fla. ‚Äî As Gerrit Cole threw his first bullpen of spring training on Friday morning, a crowd of reporters made their best efforts to get a look through the mostly-covered fence that encaged the rehabbing righty.

While those with cameras took turns sharing limited peepholes in order to snap a shot of Cole, who underwent Tommy John surgery last spring, the contingent that stood behind him enjoyed an unimpeded view. The group included manager Aaron Boone, pitching coaches Matt Blake and Desi Druschel, bench coach Brad Ausmus and guest instructor Ron Guidry, who all watched Cole consistently reach the mid-90s as he simulated two innings of work.

Cole, who had already thrown some bullpens in New York and California over the offseason, saw his velocity hit at least 96 mph, and he threw his full arsenal to Austin Wells.

‚ÄúHe looked like a Cy Young pitcher,‚Äù the catcher said of Cole, who won the award in 2023. ‚ÄúHe looked smooth and in control. He looked confident in his ability.‚Äù

‚ÄúWas nice and easy,‚Äù Guidry chimed in.

Boone agreed with those assessments, likening an in-command Cole to a ‚Äúdiver that dives off the high board and just goes in the water and makes no splash.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe looked like Gerrit Cole,‚Äù the manager added.

Cole also came away pleased, calling his session ‚Äúwell executed‚Äù while noting that his reconstructed elbow ‚Äúfeels really good.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt feels different than it has been in quite some time,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúFeel is subjective, so we‚Äôll have to see how it plays out.‚Äù

So far, all has gone according to plan for the 35-year-old, who battled elbow inflammation in 2024 before tearing his ulnar collateral ligament around this time last year. But while Cole has looked sharp thus far, Boone made it clear that the Yankees won‚Äôt be rushing him back or pushing him harder than he needs to be.

Cole, meanwhile, reiterated that full Tommy John reconstruction comes with a 14-18-month timetable.

‚ÄúSo it really hasn‚Äôt changed,‚Äù Cole said, meaning he‚Äôs looking at returning sometime in May, the earlier end of the spectrum, or June.

Earlier this week, Boone said that Cole is scheduled to start facing live hitters in ‚Äúa couple weeks‚Äù and could ‚Äúpotentially‚Äù get in games before spring training ends. Cole said the latter goal is realistic, but that isn‚Äôt set in stone.

Cole is doing his best to stay present, as he is still in the midst of what he said has been a ‚Äúlong and tedious‚Äù process. That said, he‚Äôs certainly longing for real games after sitting out the entire 2025 season.

‚ÄúI just miss playing,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI miss that outlet of working hard and feeling exhausted every five days.‚Äù

Whenever Cole does return, the Yankees will be banking on him being the best version of himself.

The club didn‚Äôt add another frontline starter this offseason despite some others having injury and workload concerns, partly because they have Cole coming back. But Tommy John surgery can come with setbacks, rust and even prolonged struggles ‚Äî look at how Atlanta‚Äôs Spencer Strider fared last year ‚Äî which is why Cole doesn‚Äôt want to get ahead of himself.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a confident guy,‚Äù Cole said. ‚ÄúI have high expectations for my execution internally, but overall, in terms of performance and expectations, I don‚Äôt really have any set goals or numbers or things like that. It‚Äôs been working really well to just stay day-to-day and execute the task at hand, so I think the challenge is to continue to do that as things become more exciting and as things start to get rolling more and more.‚Äù

Boone, however, isn‚Äôt going to doubt that Cole can return to form.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to put any ceiling on what Gerrit could do once he‚Äôs back and in the rotation,‚Äù the skipper said, noting the high success rate of Tommy John surgery.

Some have wondered if Cole will return with new experiments that he concocted during his down time, but the cerebral pitcher said not much has changed, aside from him having more time to lift in the weight room. Cole didn‚Äôt reveal any new pitches, and he said that his mechanics remain mostly the same.

There is one exception, as he‚Äôs now starting his windup by bringing his hands over his head.

‚ÄúIt feels good,‚Äù Cole said when asked about the tweak. ‚ÄúI generally just like the rhythm of it.‚Äù
